Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge's decision was reasonable in determining that applicants met residency requirements under subsection 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Mr. El Bousserghini and Ms. Kranfouli were physically present in Canada for over 1,095 days during the four-year period preceding their citizenship application
Decision_Outcome: Appeals dismissed; Citizenship Judge's decision upheld
Remedy_Requested: Minister requested overturning of the Citizenship Judge's approval of the applications
Court_Ruling: The Citizenship Judge's decision was reasonable and should not be overturned
Defendant_Behavior: Minister challenged the decision, citing insufficient evidence of residency compliance
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged insufficiency of evidence to prove residency requirement fulfillment
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence in Canada supported by passive indicia such as tax returns and utility bills
Procedural_Issue: Appeal heard by Federal Court following Citizenship Judge's approval of applications
Evidence_Used: Tax returns, utility bills, and other passive indicia of residence
Application_Basis: Residency requirement of at least three years (1,095 days) within four years prior to application
Evidence_Assessed: Passive indicia demonstrating physical presence and residential ties in Canada
Relief_Sought: Overturning of the Citizenship Judgeâ€™s decision
Governing_Rule: Permanent residents must reside in Canada for at least three out of four years before applying for citizenship
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Minister alleged deficiency but failed to demonstrate palpable error
Outcome: Appeals dismissed; original decision upholding citizenship applications maintained
Cause_Description: Citizenship application appeals based on disputed residency requirements
Evidence_Handling: Passive evidence accepted as sufficient by Citizenship Judge; Minister did not prove error
Legal_Provision_Violated: None found; compliance with subsection 5(1)(c) established
Evidence_Issues: Sufficiency of passive indicia to prove residency; no palpable error identified
Residency_Compliance: Found compliant by Citizenship Judge based on over 1,095 days of physical presence
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence assessed as sufficient to meet residency burden; reasonable interpretation by judge
Decision_Rationale: The Citizenship Judge reasonably interpreted the evidence and applied the legal standard correctly
Decision_Making_Body: Citizenship Judge, reviewed by Federal Court
Evidentiary_Issues: Challenge to sufficiency of passive evidence, but no reversal due to lack of palpable error
